result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A McGinty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
$400.00 BAIL APPLIED. Remaining balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA PAID. Balance on costs.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

It is the Defendant's burden to petition the Court to receive the benefit of expunction. Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
No violent contact with the victim.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling.
Attend Anger Management.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Joseph A McGinty in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court modified bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Joseph A McGinty did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant remains. No more walk ins to be scheduled, per court.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Joseph A McGinty did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests capias. Court grants.
Hearing on July 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
